subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: learning from UFO hunters!?
author: RetroCom
full_text:
Your so right Frank. The general public has a fixation with the 'scary', this is being exploited and promoted. There are so many ghost hunting web sites. I don't like the trend, it's like expanding knowledge and understanding is too boring or something. 

Dave

--- franks-boxes@... wrote:

From: "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: learning from UFO hunters!?
Date: Wed, 28 Mar 2007 08:15:49 -0600

Yeah, it's hard to explain. I see the focus in "ghost hunting" on the 
negative, seems like it has to be scary to appeal to the public, that's the 
first thing I don't like. Then there's the aspect of huntiing, like they are 
after subhuman animals, or something. Then there's the implication that one 
has to go to "huanted locations" to do research. You get much better 
contacts form higher spirits if you stay home. Then there's the Hollywood 
take over of ghost/itc research I don't like.

Frank
